New York fashion week is always a great idea! So many beautiful clothes to see in such a short period of time. Hood By Air, Tim Coppens, Alexander Wang, and Rochambeau were few of the many shows I attended.  It's always hard to save battery on your phone when you're trying to take as many pictures as possible. Enjoy :)

Windproof Jacket

Alexander Wang's collaboration with H&M has by far set the standard for any collaboration with H&M.  With collabs such as Versace, Maison Martin Margiela, Isabel Marant, and Lanvin, H&M reigns supreme when fusing high end designs with affordable prices that reach to the masses.  Neoprene, black, and more neoprene, and more black!  As one of my favorite fabrics and colors, Wang scored a perfect 10 in my book.  The collection is so parallel to my personal style of being sporty-chic, I just couldn't resist!

Aleali May
The Los Angeles Auto show is a convention that happens every year.  The last time I could remember attending the LA Auto show, I was too young to know the significance of car brands, details of interiors and the need for speed.  Yesterday was a great reminder of that.  From working with Audi USA on the #PAIDMYDUES campaign to owning my first luxury car, being an Audi, I shared my LA Auto Show experience with none other than the Audi team.  Audi's new head of design in Germany spoke for the first time and unveiled a concept car, the A9.  There was also the latest and fastest R8 ever and the all-new TT on the show floor.  Infiniti, Mercedes Maybach and Porsche were few of the many other luxury cars that accompanied the showroom.  @JoeyBrezinski  , @ChristianRich , and  @GuillermoAndrade  were in attendance as well.  The night ended at the London West Hollywood as Audi hosted a party to celebrate the unveilings and years of success.  I enjoyed every bit of it!
Special thanks:

"BE WARM. BE DRY. BE SEEN."
Nike #Sneakerboots are one of many Nike shoes that provide comfort and protection.  Six Los Angeles natives (including myself), were able to live the day in sneakerboots while capturing its essence for Nike Sportswear.  With different shapes, colors, and textures, everyone soon learned about the various styles of the sneakerboots.  As you can see, Nike does a phenomenal job of revolutionizing sneakers.  It's more than just a shoe, it shows a way of life, and learning how to be prepared!  Here's a recap to share my experience of what went down that Saturday, fast forward to seeing the finishing product at Blends LA in downtown Los Angeles. Enjoy!

IA
Congratulations to my friend @TheophilusLondon for a great album!  The title, "Vibes" is self-explanatory.  The album was executive produced by Kanye West.  The artwork and photography was taken by icon Karl Lagerfeld.  "Vibes" provides nothing less than high quality rhymes, rhythms, beats, and fashion!  I first met Theo about three years ago at a Been Trill x Hood By Air brunch in New York.  It was my first fashion week ever attended and I was so excited to be in the streets, seeing everyone dolled up for these fun-filled days of endless runways and fashion parties.  Three years ago, Theo still had his solid silhouette of large hats and high end tops with jeans and boots.  It was almost intimidating to meet someone with so much style, I knew I had to come correct.  Since then, I noticed Theo in Karl Lagerfeld's "Little Black Jacket" book, attending runways in Paris, and on the regular television in car commercials... even the video presentation for Apple's iPhone 6 on apple.com.  Theo has been a great mentor and friend and has always done everything with so much swag!
I had the opportunity to be apart of Theo's album, "Vibes".  He called, wanting me to hear the album and while sitting there amazed by the records, he asked to make my voice one of the official "Vibes" sample voice overs.  I had never done special FX, nor was I rapper (haha). Virgil Abloh and Benji B. then triggered all album sound-bytes.  So if you listen to songs like "Water Me" and "Get Right" and hear a calm voices repeating "vibessss", you know that's me!  
Theophilus London's new album Vibes, available HERE
Stream the album HERE

In the Eastern Columbia building downtown Los Angeles, ACNE Studios had their one year anniversary party.  Drinks were served and the vibes of the party were brought to you by Haim.  Such an amazing night around creatives!  The downtown Los Angeles area has recently become very popular as cool stores open and young adults are finding this area to be home.  Can't wait to see what the downtown area will become in the near future. Thank you so much to the ACNE Studios team for the invite, here's a recap of the celebration. Enjoy!

Fear of God Los Angeles by Jerry Lorenzo  has recently opened a holiday shop on Sunset Blvd. at one of the best stores in LA,  H. Lorenzo .  J. Lorenzo for H. Lorenzo opened early this week as supporters had the opportunity to purchase the newest collection of Fear of God LA, along with some exclusive pieces just for the pop-up.  Since the launch of the first collection leading to the recent release of the third collection, the brand has soared!  It is now being sold in boutiques and stores across the world such as Barney's New York .  The brand is infamous for its essentials, which include basic tees, flannels, crew necks and hoodies with side zippers, bomber jackets and overcoats, along with sweat shorts and pants.  Quality is great! Minimalistic but still very detailed!  With Jerry as one of my big brothers in fashion, I had the opportunity to wear some of the third collection pieces prior to the release in my interview for HYPEBEAST .   I personally wear Fear of God LA on a regular basis and they are some of the best pieces in my closet.  The shop is open December 15-21st, but always available at retail stores and online at FearofGodLA ... if it's not sold out (HA!).  Last nights event was a celebration for the holiday shop with friends and family.   Drinks provided by Hennessy.  Vibes provided by Bradley Soileau, the infamous model in your favorite Lana Del Rey videos and one of the faces for Fear of God LA.   Here's a recap, event pics below. Enjoy!
Photography: Allen Park

FIVE DAYS WITH FLEUR DU MAL
THE COVETEUR: ALEALI MAY
HYPEBEAST.COM INTERVIEW: WOMEN IN STREETWEAR AND THE INTERNET GENERATION
ALEALIMAY.COM
There have been so many opportunities presented this year and they were all great experiences.  I've learned so much this year and look forward to what 2015 has to offer.  Here are 5 of many moments I've enjoyed in the year of 2014.  Thank you to everyone's love and support, I couldn't have done it without anyone involved in each of these moments.  
5. Five Days with   Fleur du Mal  was an instagram blast of their latest lovely leather bra.  Each day there was a post on different outfits wearing the leather bra. The quality of all the brands pieces are amazing and comfortable.  Fleur du Mal is fun, flirty, a little dirty and so sexy! They specialize in dressing up and underdressing. Ladies if you haven't heard, please visit their site!  This was exciting as I worked with film photographer, Christina Paik.  Every time we come together its always magic being made.  
Photography:  Christina Paik
4. The Coveteur interview was probably the quickest shoot I've done, and by far one of the most personal, showcasing my closet, my style, and items I've grown an attachment to.  I was so ecstatic for this opportunity to be on The Coveteur next to some of my idols in fashion such as Pharrell , Anna Dello Russo and Olivier Rousteing of Balmain .  
Aleali for The Coveteur
3. HYPEBEAST.COM Interview was an interview to voice my opinion and answer questions about women in street wear and fashion trends amidst the digital generation.  This interview was unlike any interview I've done before.  It hit close to heart as being a women in the street wear world is still new and improving.  Women are making their mark everyday whether it's in or out of the street wear culture, and everyones contribution counts.  The digital generation is also new and the pros and cons of the internet bring up so many questions about where will this all go... are we moving too fast? Can we keep up? So many questions!!! 
Aleali May for Hypebeast  
2. Audi USA presents their first social media campaign called #PaidMyDues.  More than 15 creators, artists, musicians, filmmakers, and performers shared moments of how they paid their dues.  The footage was live one day in the month of May as we sat and watch everything in full effect at a Santa Monica Airport Hanger.  The campaign was brought to you by the latest model of the Audi A3 2015.  The Audi brand is from Germany, and showcases their roots through sleek designs, premium interior and need for speed.  Ever since the Audi campaign, I was persuaded to own an Audi... sooooo, I got one (LOL).  It's amazing to say the least and their customer service is top notch! Not only are they interested in making better cars, they're interested in the consumer!  
 Aleali for #PaidMyDues  
1.  ALEALIMAY the site.  This has been the best accomplishment of 2014 for me, as I launched this site a couple months ago.  It took so long to actually put this into fruition but we're here!  Without photographer @AllbyAllen and many others that contributed to this site, it wouldn't showcase my vision as great it does.  On here I showcase events I attend, places I go, my experiences and outfits.  I mean, no need to write too much on what blog is about... cause I've placed it in the ABOUT section (HA!).  Thank you again for everyones support and tuning in every week. Love!
Aleali May for AlealiMay.com

UO PREVIEW : "This month at UO, we're inspired by duos of all kinds, whether it's couples or coworkers, bandmates or brothers: sometimes the best, most unexpected results come from the power of two, and we're diving into these stories to learn more about lots of different pairs. One of our favorite discoveries is the creative collaboration of Aleali May and Allen Park. A stylist force to be reckoned with, Aleali has her hands in tons of different compelling facets of the fashion world, from her start working with clothing brands as a teenager to today working as a stylist and image consultant. On the other side is her partner in crime Allen Park, who shoots the editorials that Aleali styles for her blog and is the behind-the-scenes man turning her ideas into reality. One afternoon in LA, we decided to flip the lens and pair them together for a shoot reflective of their signature minimal-modern style, having them both put their own twist on some of our favorite black and white UO pieces, and divulge more about their personal style. "
Outfit 1: Fear of God LA Flannel and Muscle Shirt, Rick Owens Black Shorts over UO  "Out From Under"  Black Leggings, and Vans Vault White Leather Vans 
Outfit 2: Theory Leather Jacket over UO   "Tee Library A Picture"  Shirt, Venus x Mars Sweatpants, and Air Jordan 1's
More images and the full interview HERE

Yesterday evening in Los Angeles, Louis Vuitton invited me to their "Series 2" Exhibition.  All guest had a chance to discover a presentation of the timeless inspirations behind Louis Vuitton's new collection.  Filled with seven different rooms that cherished Louis Vuitton's past, leading up to the present day of Spring/ Summer 2015 Ready-to-Wear collection, and the future of LV.  Rooms include a recreation of access to a backstage runway and the show, a poster room, and gallery of trunks and accessories.  My favorite room was the "Talking Faces". I admired each room of the exhibition as it brought back memories of working for Louis Vuitton.  The exhibition is open to the public February 6th through the 22nd at 1135 North Highland Avenue.  I encourage everyone to see it if in Los Angeles!

Aleali May

SWEAT THE CREW
SWEAT THE LOOK: THE LOCKER ROOM 
SweatTheStyle.com is a lifestyle site that focuses on sports fashion, fitness, health and more!  Adrianne Ho , model and founder of Sweat The Style showcases not only herself, but other women with similar lifestyles in a section of her website called Sweat The Crew .  Honored to being featured for STC, Adrianne shot photos of me in my favorite Rick Owens vest, Rick Owens Sweats, Nike Lab Air Force 1's and Adrianne's "Sweat" active wear.  We had a great time working as I really enjoy seeing women of similar interests create together! The images on your right are from The Locker Room's Vintage editorial featuring myself.  Styled with  For All To Envy's vintage pieces, I chose to shoot in this Lakers jersey, Jordan crew neck, Adidas jacket, Ice Cube and Mike Tyson tee as they are most relatable to my background of being from Los Angeles, a huge fan of sports and more in depth, Michael Jordan.  You can purchase any one of these awesome pieces and others from  The Locker Room !

ELLE GIRL JAPAN HERE

Aleali May
March 26th is marked as a worldwide celebration for Nike's infamous Air Max Shoe.  Yesterday, I was invited to a VIP private event with six other Nike Women influences to celebrate Nike Air Max Day.  Through this experience,  we had the chance to reunite or meet with legendary designer and the man who started it all, Tinker Hatfield.  Nike also brought their Air Max Box to hold the event in.  The last time we saw the Air Max Box in the United States was earlier this year in New York for All Star Weekend.  Nike Air Max fans have been celebrating this special day throughout the world, and it all ended here in Los Angeles at this special event titled "The One Before The 1".  There were sneaker heads, designers, influencers and many others that joined in on this experience.  We were also gifted a special pair of Air Max shoes as I got my personal Nike iD Air Max's signed by Tinker!  He spoke about the process of the Air Max and the evolution.  Caterers, manicurists, artists, infamous sneaker cleaner guru, Jason Markk and his crew were also in attendance which assisted in making our Nike Air Max Day one for the books.  It was such a great experience and definitely a learning one!  Thank you Nike!

Aleali May

Written By bryanboy
My friend Jane wanted to bring me to this club called Caligulla but I told her I’m gonna call off the night because I had to wake up early tomorrow. I know myself when I go clubbing — I drink an awful lot, do some stuff and dance till it’s 6 or 7 in the morning.
Prevention is better than cure.
So off I went to the hotel, checked my emails a little bit and then Mark’s friend Valery called me to checked what I was doing. She said she had 2 friends who wanted to see me and asked if they can drop by at my room and maybe we can all have a chat. I said ok — as long as we’re not going out etc cause I had to wake up early tomorrow.
Fast forward 1 hour later, Valery, Natasha and Yulia (the one with the blonde bangs) arrived.
All girls are soo soo fun. Natasha’s english is great. Whereas Yulia… oh my god, Yulia is just like "Bubbles" from Absolutely Fabulous. She’s one crazy girl – she’s a journalist of some sort for some Russian Music/MTV-like channel. She likes to make these little facial things which are sooo cute. I have this body shimmer powder thing and we played around with it like little teenage girls. LOL.
Natasha, Moi, Yulia at my room
Yulia, Natasha, Valery

DAY 1: THE ISLAND OF NGOR
The first day landing in Senegal, I visited the island of Ngor.  Traveling by boat to the island, we had a traditional Senegalese meal that included fish, rice, chicken, a sauce containing onions and carrots, and beer.  On the island, there were many locals that sold art, handmade jewelry, and clothing from traditional fabrics.  The streets were tagged with graffiti art and paintings that expressed the minds of the locals.  Ngor is known for its laid back environment and is the home to many surfers.
DAY 2: THE ISLAND OF GORÉE
I had the privilege of visiting the island of Gorée.  The island is known for its astounding history.  Our friend, born and raised on the island of Gorée, gave us the insiders tour.  My favorite and most emotional part about the island was visiting the House of Slaves.  The place where over 12 million slaves were shipped all throughout the Americas, Caribbean, Dominican Republic, Cuba, and many other places.   We had a chance to stand in each room where the slaves were separated by sex and age.  Reflecting on the conditions and seeing the Door of No Return, made it emotional for everyone.  The Door of No Return reflects the moment the slaves were shipped away, to never see their homes again. It also reflects the slaves that did not make it onto the boat due to illness, in which they were thrown out into the water, where they couldn't survive.  Today it is a landmark and one of the most talked about places in your school history books when referring to this time in history.  There are also monumental canons around the island in which we met a few men selling their sculptures and paintings.  Art on the island of Gorée is everywhere, and just like America, they absolutely love Tupac! This was one of my best days spent in Dakar, Senegal.  I could never forget this day.
DAY 3: CHEZ SALIM - LAC ROSE & The Seed Project's Culture Night
Lac Rose, also known as the Pink Lake, was once a lake filled with fish.  Later, the fish ended up disappearing one by one and the lake produced salt.  With the position of the sun and also the salt, the lake can give off the same effect of pink lemonade (but not as delightful if you drink it).  Men and women gather buckets and boats of salt and divide them into sections on the shore.  Most of the salt is exported and used in cities that need salt for the ground, to disintegrate the ice on the sidewalks.  We visited the nearby villages, sand dunes and the beach.  This whole journey was brought to us by four wheelers and a tour guide.  Crops of mint and turnips grew in between villages, with even a fresh water supply dug from the ground.  After the festivities, we ate on the shores local restaurant and later attended culture night at The Seed Academy.
DAY 4 & 5:  THE SEED ACADEMY 
The Seed Academy is a non profit organization that runs an academy for young boys and girls.  They use basketball and education as their platform to prepare opportunities in Senegal.  With both education and talent, kids are prone to opportunities outside of Africa with scholarships and many more benefits.  The days spent with the Seed Academy were amazing.  The kids had been working hard and playing against each other all season in basketball games called the Hoop Forum.  For lunch that day, we had a traditional Senegalese meal with local drinks of ginger, chicken and sautéed onion, and rice.  The last day held the final game at the Marius Ndiaye Stadium.  East won vs. West as NBA players Wilson Chandler of the Denver Nuggets and Gorgui Dieng of the Minnesota Timberwolves helped coach both sides.  The Seed Academy showed so much love and were great hosts during my stay in Senegal.  This isn't a farewell message, 'cause I'll be back!

Aleali May

Why Fatshion Insider...?
A bit of an intro if you will...
I've been working in fashion & entertainment for nearly 10 years and as a plus size, African American female you can guess that my journey has at times been quite interesting.
Having worked with fashion brands & retailers both plus and straight size, I've had the chance to see the industry change quite dramatically over the last few years and it's exciting! As a publicist I've worked with magazines including InStyle, Glamour, O the Oprah Magazine and many others but I'd really love to see more than one "curvy girl" outfit on 300+ pages.
My goal is to share some of my adventures, fashion that I love and where to find it...There's SO much more fashion available for sizes 10 and larger these days (no excuse for boxy tees and pleated khakis). I'll begin posting in the next few days - Follow me :)
xo,

city chic - here's what I'm thinkin'
It's been a while since my last blog post...please do forgive me but I have one terribly unfashionable word for you: CRUTCHES! ugh. Anyhoo, I'll try to work in OOTD posts here and there but right now my wardrobe consists of easy to pull on sweats and that's hardly interesting. So, back to businesss!
City Chic launched in the US a few months ago and I must admit, I was sort of excited. They had these titillating emails with a count down clock enticing me to check back with the website as they delayed the launch for a few weeks. When it finally went live my first response was..."seriously?" A hand full of "eh" pieces that were a little to juniors department for my taste.
Fast forward to a few days ago: I went onto CityChicOnline.com and thought, hmmm...now we are talking! It reads to me like a hybrid of Torrid and Asos. There is still a fair amount of "eh" but there are also some pretty stand out pieces that don't look like stuff you can find anywhere and really are CHIC. Below are a few of my favs:
The above Mesh Studded Skater Top is my favorite thing on the site. The kimono style top has mesh inserts on the shoulders and back and looks effortlessly cool. I love easy tops that are comfy but have dope details that add interest. This will be MINE, oh yes...it will be mine!
The So Cute Contrast dress (blk/coral) is really "so cute" but looks like a few things I already own so I don't feel like I'm dying to have it but it's adorable and worth featuring. To be honest if the black bodice where white it'd be a little more edgy and more of something I want to own. The Caltlyn Maxi dress is great. Something I'd want to wear to a pool party with embellished flats. And lastly the Zip Front Dress has a fantastic geometric print and is great for now with tights and leather or summer with sandals. *Thumbs UP*
These Self Tie Cargo slacks seem sooooo versatile! Pair them with a slouchy jersey top, a sexy tuxedo blazer or even this Silver Lace Top. I forever love denim but trousers are the new sexy. Pumps, Chuck Taylors, Flip Flops...Hotness.

The Color of Love
This past Tuesday I had the pleasure of popping by the Anna Scholz showroom to meet the UK based designer and preview the brands fall2011 collection. Anna and her sales team were in the city for sales and press appointments at the AKA Hotel penthouse in midtown.
When I arrived I took a quick look at the collection and was instantly attracted to the color stories. Anna Scholz is known for saturated color and prints on sumptuous fabrics, which generally I find near missing in most other plus size collections.
Anna walked me through the collection and then we had a chat: We spoke about how it all started. Anna began sewing very early on in life. As a six foot tall size 14 teenager, making clothes happened really out of necessity. She would receive fabrics and tools for presents or instead of shopping trips; which I find completely cool.
While Anna doesn't name her collections or work from a specific "theme", fall 2011 certainly feels inspired. It's a well rounded collection of dresses, tops, trousers and fabulous coats. Having seen quite a bit of luxe 70's inspiration on the runways this past fashion week, the collection definitely touched on the trend. Many of the pieces reminded me of what a reformed 70's rocker chick would wear. I say reformed because the clothes are polished and are bound to make you look really put together so, she'd be well beyond the drunken mess phase of life.
I'm obsessed with the leopard, vintage bird and geometric prints shown above! Anna and I discussed how so many plus women want to fade into the background and shy away from bold colors and especially prints but her love of the audacious has really set her apart and has been the foundation of a very loyal customer base. I certainly don't believe in hidding and don't want to be invisible.
What was great about these clothes is that even though it gave a nod to the 70's trend everything was also really modern. The fringe shown above gives so much life to this LBD and just when you thought you didn't love lace (which I absolutely do!), here comes a lace motorcylce jacket with edgy zipper details that you didn't even know you needed! Over all I LOVE this collection and want nearly all of it. Below are a few pictures of what's available at AnnaScholz.com for spring/summer. So cute!
My Outfit Deets: Coat:Vintage Dress:Asos Blazer: Calvin Klein Necklace: Forever21 Belt:Torrid Boots:Steve Madden Handbag:BCBG

February 18, 2011
GAUDY never looked so GOOD
I sort of half assed it through most of fashion week because I'm just now off crutches and honestly, standing around for hours isn't really tops on my "I can't wait!" list...but there were a few things I refused to miss. Amongst them...Indashio's FW11 Show.
If you haven't heard of him, you soon will. Indashio is a stylist, TV Personality and genuinely one of the nicest people in fashion. We met a few years back when I was putting together the Nolcha Fashion Week Shows and his over the top FUN personality won me over instantly. He's dressed Kim Kardashian, Paris Hilton, Amber Rose and many others.
Anyhoo...I went down to the show early to check out the Style360 set up at the Metropolitan Pavilion and get some back stage scoop and shots. As I'm waiting on line (they aren't letting press in yet), Indashio strolls up to the door in a trench coat that made him look like he either had a lots of acid in his pockets or a bunch of skittles...or both! (Taste the rainbow - mmm).
He sees me standing on the line, gives a warm hug and yells at security to "Let Kellie in, she's cold!". Skipping the line was def great as I was wearing a leather jacket and was in fact FREEZING.
The collection is called "GAUDY" and it was just that in the best possible way. It was flashy and "look at me" and cool. Inspiration: Liberace and Trident's new gum Trident Vitality.
Never without a cast of merry characters, this shows casting was really incredible. Johnny Wier, Aubrey O'Day, Keenya from cycle 4 of America's Next Top model...all added flavor on the runway. Front row included Denise Richards, Adrienne Ballion, Kat De Luna, and one of my biggest model crushes Omahyra Mota.
P.S. love the thickness in some of the models! I'm not one of those gals that are against rail thin models, they serve a purpose but I think there should be a balance and there was plenty of hips in this show.

June 24, 2011
Cross My Heart and Hope to TIE
I went home (Philly) a few weeks ago to hang with my fam and to celebrate Father's day a little early since I had a wedding on Father's Day weekend. As always family time is nothing short of a blast, I have one of those made for TV families...not the Jerry Springer type but closer to the Cosby's. We actually like each other and enjoy spending time which is really fantastic.
You always hear Father's Day dread stories of Dad getting some terrible tie and smiling kindly and wearing it for the kids. This Father's Day was a bit different. My dad recently lost some weight and was cleaning out his closet and playing dress up (so sweet). Fast forward, the next morning I'm hanging out in my parents room and see a Yves Saint Laurent tie in a pile of "throw away clothes". First thought "SCORE!!!", second thought...hmm is my sister going to fight me fore it?
I take the tie into the bathroom as I was getting dressed and when I come out of the shower it's GONE! Yep, she took it. (Ok...don't panic, you can get the tie back).
ME: "Oh Karla, did you take my tie?"
Sister: "YES! It's Daddy's you can't take it"
I call my father and ask if i can have it, to which he answers "Yeah sure, I was going to throw it away...it's out of style, from the 70's".
SCORE! - I think it worked pretty well with the outfit I'd already planned on wearing.

Get to know Clique to Know
We've all heard of membership discount sites i.e. Ideeli and Ru La La...who doesn't like exclusive deals? And yes, shopping for accessories and other bobbles from these sites is fantastic. But wouldn't it be great if the clothes were available in sizes beyond 10?
Enter Clique to Know...a new site launching June 28th. From the press release: "Clique to Know is a new members only flash sales site dedicated to women's designer fashion from size 10 and up, at discount prices. Initial sales lined up include brands such as Rachel Pally, Arnold Zimberg, Earnest Sewn, Rani Zakhem, Jag Jeans and T-Bags...".
Discounts will be between 50-80% off retail! Excited yet? I am!
Other brands soon to be featured on the site include; Lafayette 148, Z from Zenobia, Taylor Dresses, Kay Unger and Phoebe Couture.
I had the chance to speak to Melissa Ramos, CEO of Clique to Know...who is lovely and she says: "I started Clique to Know because so many of my friends and family are size 10+ and it seems ridiculous that just because you are over a certain dress size, shopping for designer labels becomes difficult. Clique to Know will also be offering shoes, accessories, lingerie and beauty" making the site a true one stop shop.
Sign up for membership now to receive a $10 coupon for the site!

GIVEAWAY - PZI Jeans
The wonderful folks at PZI came to me to do an amazing giveaway with Fatshion Insider followers. PZI Jeans are created for curvy gals with both hour glass and pear shapes. What does that mean?
Your waist is significantly smaller than your hips and bottom. See PZI models below. This body type can be really hard to fit for jeans because you may need a size 8 waist, but size 12 to fit around your butt. What's great about PZI is that they are cut to fit your largest area and tapered at the waist so that there is no gaping.
I'm giving away a pair of PZI Jeans to one lucky Fatshion Insider follower! The jeans come in sizes 4-18 and retail for about $100. One of the pair featured below will be yours! All you have to do is follow the blog if you aren't already doing so it's very easy, just click follow on the homepage and follow the simple instructions from there. Then leave a comment on this post "I want PZI Jeans" and you will be entered to win. The contest will run from today - Sunday July 3rd. Good luck!

from the past 80 years into a bespoke range of elegant vintage garments
which could slot into any ladies' wardrobe as perfectly now as the decade
in which they were conceived.
Rare and exclusive vintage fabrics are used in the collection,
adorned with vintage trimmings, all sourced from extensive treasure
hunts and created using hand-crafted, traditional techniques to ensure
the highest quality throughout. The collection is unified in it's
flattering,
wearable nature; from the elegant 70’s-inspired Kimono Maxi to the
high waisted 40’s Pencil Skirt, each piece has been designed with the
modern figure in mind, using impeccable tailoring and intelligent pattern
and fabric choice to elongate, emphasise and flatter today’s woman
and her body.
Each piece will be totally unique, though the basic shapes will
remain the same, and incredibly environmentally friendly. The collection
is available in 3 sizes: Small (8/10), Medium (10/12) and Large (12/14).Or alternatively you can come in to the studio and have items made to measure.

"New Girl"
I loooove Zoe Dechanel. I was looking forward to her new FOX show "New Girl" and it was actually pretty funny. Premise is, she's an odd ball chick who finds her boyfriend in bed with another girl and ends up finding three male roommates online to share an apt with. Within episode one they realize she's a bit of a maniac (watching "Dirty Dancing" five times a day, crying etc), get her out to get back on the dating horse, she's stood up...then they bond over rescuing her from the embarrassment of being stood up.
Anyhoo Zoe is a style icon and rightfully so. Though her style isn't really the same as mine, I love her aesthetic and point of view as it relates to fashion. She marries whimsy and cool like no other. It's like June Cleaver is transplanted to the East Village in the late 70's smokes some weed and decided to add a thin patent belt and punky heels to her dresses. Or...something, ha. Asos has a bunch of very Zoe-esque fabness for under $100. Here it is.

September 9, 2011
Popping in on some Pop-Ups - FNO
As much of the world knows, last night was Fashion's Night Out. Though I was leaning toward reading about the evenings madness on my Twitter timeline, one of my good friends is in town from Miami and I decided not to be anti-social. So we headed out.
The night began and ended with lots and lots of traffic. We were headed to a VEVO event, then noticed that we mistook the event address for the after party address after letting the cab go. We ended up having to walk to the event...grabbing a slice on the way (starving!)
As irony would have it after woofing down a slightly gross slice, we arrive at Vevo only to learn it's a sit down dinner with a pretty fabulous looking menu, Robin Thicke is to perform. Etc. Etc.
Instead of wasting time at a dinner for which we weren't hungry, we left and joined the mayhem that was the Meat Packing District.
Here's what I wore...easy, comfortable. What I loved most is my "newish" Rebecca Minkoff hot pink snake skin printed bag. Complete with delicious gold chain shoulder strap and hardware *swoon*. I say "newish" because I got it this summer and just started using it last week at a dinner with friends. You will be seeing this bag a lot, ob-sessed. I have another Rebecca Minkoff bag which I rarely wear I don't know what my problem is but I'm practicing a new habit of wearing my things not just staring at them prettily arranged in my closet.
And so we ran around popping in and out of pop-ups and boutiques. A few standouts: The Tracy Reese store was hilarious. People "booty dancing" in the store windows, music blaring and inside, kind of like a bizarre nightclub. After surfing through the hair flailing and grinding couples, I spotted a really cute cape (see above) which made me smile (see above). Note: the chick on the blackberry is my friend Franny who...was getting her work/party combo on.
Another good time had was at Elizabeth Charles, a fab high-end boutique featuring all Australian designers. She was a client of mine about (mumble) years ago. I launched the original store location on Perry Street when she was bringing major brands like Sass & Bide to the US. So great to see her, stop by there if you want exclusive designer finds from the land of down under.
We ended up at Calypso and Catherine Malandrino...but CM was closed so sad, the party we actually went down there for. Still a good time, bumped into the lovely Lauren Ruotolo from Hearst and her boo snapped some cool pics for me, I hope to see them soon! The END- ha.

October 15, 2011
I think I'm FALLing for you
I've been purging my closets and doing the whole seasonal switch thing which for me, is quite an undertaking! But it's always great to go through your things each season, see what you love and want to keep, get rid of things you no longer love, then you can see what's missing/what you need to add and let the shopping begin. Here are a few things that caught my eye:
1. I looooove slick shades. These cat eye black/brown sunglasses from Versace are on SunglassHut.com. Another great place to find designer shades on the cheap is Nordstrom Rack and Off Saks - rows upon rows of Fendi, Gucci, Marc Jacobs, Versace up to 60% off.
2. I'm not just addicted to animal prints, I also love animal jewelry. I usually am drawn to snakes, tigers and elephants. Kenneth Jay Lane is one of my fav jewelry designers and this tiger cuff is EVERYTHING. ShopBop.com
3. To say that I love leather would be an understatement, leather pants beyond mandatory for my fall wardrobe. Leather pants can be tricky in plus, I want them TIGHT and not cut like trousers so I opted for these leather leggings from OneStopPlus (Jessica London) - I've actually already received these in the mail and they are amazing, the front is leather and the back a nice thick knit fabric. They fit like leggings but don't have a lot of give so don't order a size down.
4. I've gone just little crazy this season with leather jackets. The waterfall was huge last season and I'm not letting it go. Nordstrom.com for this one.
5. Capes are EVERYWHERE, but don't just look to plus brands for a great cape. Obviously the sizing is quite big so look to other brands for a great cape. This one is incredible from Cynthia Steffe and I have to have it!! I'm annoyed that Bloomingdales only has sizes 0 and 4 left since I have a 25% coupon to shop online there. But Saks.com has it in sizes up to 12... which should fit perfectly.
6. Colored pants are just great. I don't really have much more to say than...get yourself a great pair of colored pants! NOW! These are going to be great with all of my leather jackets, and animal prints. AsosCurve
7. A cool bag that adds interest is a must. This as all of my previously mentioned obsessions rolled into one super cute bag. Rebecca Minkoff - Saks, Bloomies, ShopBop she's everywhere.
8. Another magical jewelry moment from the one and only Alexis Bittar. He just gets me, that's why I GET so many of his pieces. AlexisBittar.com - great pieces, a little pricey but worthy investments!
9. I just love this look. Prairie New York is a great contemporary plus brand you can find in better department stores, really great. Another trend I really find myself gravitating toward is Tuxedo inspired pieces and this Tuxedo Bib Dress looks effortlessly fab. Salon Z on Saks.com
10. Personally I'm on a constant hunt for black wedge boots, stumbled across these on Revolve.com and the white insert on the heel coupled with the studs has my heart beating fast but I personally need a little more lift in the front for comfort. (Bad knee wackness) But I couldn't resist featuring them they are HOT.
